author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...KIKO NOW A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS LATER THIS WEEK BRINGING SURF AND RIP CURRENT IMPACTS TO PORTIONS OF THE ISLANDS...
summary: ...KIKO NOW A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS LATER THIS WEEK BRINGING SURF AND RIP CURRENT IMPACTS TO PORTIONS OF THE ISLANDS... As of 5:00 AM HST Mon Sep 08 the center of Kiko was located near 20.3, -148.8 with movement WNW at 15 mph. The minimum central pressure was 984 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 85 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...KIKO NOW A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS LATER THIS WEEK BRINGING SURF AND RIP CURRENT IMPACTS TO PORTIONS OF THE ISLANDS... As of 5:00 AM HST Mon Sep 08 the center of Kiko was located near 20.3, -148.8 with movement WNW at 15 mph. The minimum central pressure was 984 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 85 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Kiko (CP4/EP112025)
